org.hibernate.jpa.event.internal.core

Class JpaDeleteEventListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hibernate.event.internal.DefaultDeleteEventListener
      • org.hibernate.jpa.event.internal.core.JpaDeleteEventListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, DeleteEventListener, HibernateEntityManagerEventListener, CallbackRegistryConsumer

    public class JpaDeleteEventListener
extends DefaultDeleteEventListener
implements CallbackRegistryConsumer
    Overrides the LifeCycle OnSave call to call the PreRemove operation
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • performDetachedEntityDeletionCheck

        protected void performDetachedEntityDeletionCheck(DeleteEvent event)
        Description copied from class: DefaultDeleteEventListener
        Called when we have recognized an attempt to delete a detached entity.

        This is perfectly valid in Hibernate usage; JPA, however, forbids this. Thus, this is a hook for HEM to affect this behavior.

        Overrides:
        performDetachedEntityDeletionCheck in class DefaultDeleteEventListener
        Parameters:
        event - The event.
